sense.name: make or become so that one part covers the other
sense.commentary: NP1[+agent] FOLD (NP2[+concrete]) NOTE: The object being folded consists of one entity folding in on itself like a sheet or map etc.
sense.examples: Fold these sheets and put them away. He folded up the map with a sense of finality. Do you know how to fold a paper airplane? This bed folds up.

sense.name: intertwine corresponding body parts
sense.commentary: NOTE: If any object that is not a body part is included in the folding, see sense 3. Compare the third example of this sense with the third example of sense 3.
sense.examples: He folded his arms and glared. She quietly folded her hands in her lap. The priest folded his hands over the large wooden cross.

sense.name: incorporate or enclose one thing in another
sense.commentary: NOTE: compare the third example of this sense with the third example of sense 2.
sense.examples: Fold the nuts into the batter. My dad folded the twenty dollar bill into his wallet. The priest folded the wooden cross in his hands.

sense.name: cease to operate or participate
sense.examples: That shop folded about a month ago. Either toss in your bet or fold.

sense.name: enclose domestic animals in a pen
sense.examples: He went round to see the cattle folded. Jacob counts the sheep as he folds them.
